abstract: Differing positions on minimum wage between New York Gov Andrew Cuomo and New Jersey Gov Chris Christie could result in starkly different pay rates at New York's Kennedy International and La Guardia airports and New Jersey's Newark Liberty International Airport; Cuomo supports $15 minimum wage, which Christie has vetoed; final decision comes from Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, and given that each governor controls half of agency's board of commissioners, final decision could well be split, with New York workers getting higher pay.
lead_paragraph: The airports are all run by the same agency, but New York’s governor has backed $15 an hour, while New Jersey’s governor rejected a bill to raise his state’s base wage to that level.

headline.main: Minimum-Wage Rift May Lead to Competing Pay Scales at New York Area’s Airports
headline.print_headline: Governors’ Rift on Wages  May Upend Pay Scales  for Airport Workers
